intro: Pellionia funingensis, commonly known as the Funing pellionia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Pellionia funingensis is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
